text: Menashe Kadishman (lrm;; 21 August 1932 - 8 May 2015) was an Israeli sculptor and painter. He presented his artworks in central locations in Israel, such as Habima Square. His paintings can be found in many different galleries in Israel. He is most famous for his metallic sculptors and colorful paintings of sheep. In 1995, he won the Israel Prize. Kadishman was born in Tel Aviv. He was divorced and had two children. Kadishman died on 8 May 2015 in Ramat Gan, aged 82. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1932 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Israeli Jews Category:Jewish artists Category:Israeli painters Category:People from Tel Aviv Category:Israeli sculptors
title: Menashe Kadishman
